headline: What Analysts Think Is Changing the Story for Micron Technology Stock
summary: Micron Technology's fair value estimate has been lifted sharply to about $249.31 per share, while the discount rate has nudged higher to roughly 10.67%, reflecting a more demanding return hurdle even as long term growth expectations climb. Behind these moves is a growing view that Micron sits at the heart of an AI driven memory supercycle, with rising demand for high bandwidth memory and DRAM in data centers supporting stronger revenue growth assumptions near 24.21%. Stay tuned to see how you...

headline: Analysts Boost Micron (MU) Price Targets as AI Demand Drives Growth
summary: Micron Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MU) is one of the best affordable AI stocks to buy now. On December 12, Stifel raised its price target on Micron (NASDAQ:MU) to $300, up sharply from $195, and reiterated its Buy rating. The firm pointed to accelerating demand for AI infrastructure as a key inflection point for the industry, noting […]

headline: Jobs Data, Inflation Report, Micron Earnings: Coming This Week
summary: The last full trading week before Christmas is looking busy. Key economic data that was delayed by the shutdown is due, including the jobs report and the consumer-price index for November. Some Federal Reserve policymakers are due to speak, after the central bank's latest rate cut last week, and a reasonably busy earnings calendar includes earnings from Nike, FedEx and Micron.

headline: Buy Micron Stock, Analyst Says. Look at Soaring Memory Chip Prices.
summary: The rise in memory-chip prices will last for several quarters, which bodes well for Micron shareholders, according to Needham.  On Tuesday, analyst N. Quinn Bolton raised his price target for  Micron Technology  stock to $300 from $200.  Micron is a leader in the markets for dynamic random-access memory, or DRAM, which is used in desktop computers and servers, and for flash memory, found in smartphones and solid-state hard drives.

headline: Billionaire David Tepper Sells These 5 Stocks to Buy This 1 Stock
summary: David Tepper is one of the most successful hedge fund managers in history, with a net worth of ~$23.7 billion. He’s been selling UnitedHealth (NYSE:UNH), Intel (NASDAQ:INTC), Alibaba (NYSE:BABA), Vistra (NYSE:VST), and Micron (NASDAQ:MU). He’s piling into a lesser-known stock instead called Whirlpool (NYSE:WHR), and we’ll look into why in a bit. Tepper is the ... Billionaire David Tepper Sells These 5 Stocks to Buy This 1 Stock

headline: Micron Dominates Barchart's Top 100 with Killer Volume—Your Buy Signal?
summary: In Monday’s trading, Micron Technology jumped 14 spots in Barchart’s Top 100 Stocks to Buy, into 36th position. Of the top 100, Micron’s price volume was the highest at 6.53 million, nearly four times higher than the runner-up.
